original_title: Sri Lanka finally set for proper targeting on 208 bln rupee fresh welfare programme
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka finally has come up with plans to target financial assistance to the poor and needy people, officials said, after decades of failure in its poverty alleviation progranmes as the crisis-hit economy has been compelled to look into such schemes by multilateral financial institutions.
The latest welfare scheme will be effective from July this year.

Sri Lanka’s Finance Ministry has selected 3.3 million applicants including households and individuals to be eligible for President Ranil Wickremesinghe government’s new plan to empower the poor families.

“Out of this, 2 million applicants are from families and around 300,000 are individuals including disabled people, elders, and people who are suffering from chronic kidney diseases,” B. Wijayaratne, the Chairman of the Welfare Benefits Board under the Finance Minister, told a media briefing.

He said the current 3.3 million applicants will be reduced to 2.3 million in the next 40 days after a 10-day time period to protest over the current selection and a 30-day time period to probe into such protests.
The new scheme will cost 208 billion annually with families categorized under extreme poverty expected to receive up to 15,000 rupees a month.

Families categorized under poverty will receive 8,500 rupees a month, families under vulnerable for poverty will receive 5,000 rupees, and families under transition category will get a monthly transfer payment of 2,500 rupees, finance ministry officials said.
Apart from this individuals such as elders, people suffering with chronic kidney disease, and disabled people will be given 5,000 rupees.

The Acting Finance Minister made the details of the selected 3.3 million applicants public through the official website www.wbb.gov.lk to facilitate public protests and ensure transparency. (Colombo/June 20/2023)
